message: anyone run into this problem before?
I'm having an issue with vim taking forever to start when I open an HTML file
running vim -V9 html.log test.html shows that it seems to search through a massive number of potential files:
hundreds of files like that from plugins that don't actually exist
could u pass the html file? maybe i can have a check
well, I've removed all my html-related plugins and commented out any possibly relevant vimrc lines
it's still doing it. the weird thing is that it's only in console vim (not MacVim), and only for html (not xml)
update: it's when syntax is turned on. if I take out "syntax on" or set an autocmd to do "syntax off" for html files, it doesn't have a delay
well, I wrote this to fix the problem: https://gist.github.com/900075. looks like html syntax just does a lot of sourcing from runtimepath, so I made a wrapper to limit this
